This is a fantastic little studio, just a few minutes drive from the centre of Armidale. 

The studio has been fantastically renovated, and is very modern. The place was absolutely sparkling clean, had a large and very comfortable bed, and an amazing bath tub and shower. 

Overall, the location is very quiet, and the studio is located on a large rural property that is well back from the road. 

The studio is also dog friendly, and we had our Cattle Dog x Border Collie with us on the trip. She loved the property too, and spent hours roaming the paddock, followed by long naps on the front deck overlooking the hills. 

I would highly recommend this studio if you are travelling through this area. It’s good for couples only though, as it’s too small for a family. 

Just one word of warning if you’re travelling with your dog. The studio shares a common wall with a cottage, and we could sometimes hear the person in the cottage moving about, especially at night when things are quiet. Those sounds freaked our dog out a little bit on the first night, but then she calmed down and got used to it. Just something to keep in mind if your dog is a bit skittish. 

Five stars for Two Dog Folly.

23845708:
Twodogfolly's studio is a beautiful little space with great views across the valley. It's a duplex sort of arrangement with the cottage attached, but the wall between seems to be soundproofed and we found the studio very private and a relaxing space to spend time in.

Michael is an excellent host and we look forward to staying there again in the future.
51261994: There are two accommodation choices at Twodogfolly. We booked the smaller of the choices - The Studio - and although much smaller, it is no lesser. The level of appointments are very high and very stylish. In most respects, The Studio is probably the superior, as it faces the valley through which the feeder road runs and sunsets can be taken in from the sumptuous bath, because with the door open onto the verandah, the sun sits right on the edge of the tub. The bathroom has been completely re-done, with large river pebble facade tiles on the floor and narrow valley quasi corrugated iron for much of the height of the walls. The living area/kitchen is compact but well appointed and behind a floor to ceiling wall partition, is a very comfortable queen-sized bed. The unit lacks for nothing and even includes a western facing deck with outdoor table and chairs for the cheese and bickies and glass of wine once you extricate yourself from the bath. In three days, we were visited by ten bird species, a couple of cows and a mob of kangaroos came right up to the deck on the last afternoon. Only saw the host on the first afternoon and once he knew we wanted to be left alone, that's just what he did. It was clear that he would have catered for any additional needs we might have had. Small but perfect for a couple and despite the bush setting, the Armidale CBD is five minutes away.

We were really impressed with the Shouse, and loved our stay. There property is beautiful and has horses (a great novelty for us), and the absence of light pollution also makes it perfect for stargazing. Although close to Armidale (only about 5-10min away from the city centre), it felt like we were in the middle of the countryside: quiet and surrounded by farmland.

Inside, the decor is stylish and cosy. The amenities are clean and work well, with abundant provisions of utensils/soaps/towels/cushions/blankets. There is even a smartphone provided with Netflix! In particular, the amount and variety of food provided in the Shouse is truly stupendous, and we left incredibly well-fed.

We do reiterate the point made on the listing that the single toilet is in a slightly awkward place—it is the ensuite of the smallest bedroom. Not the end of the world, though. The kitchen sink is slightly awkward (the tap is a little too high, and its corner location is a little odd). We also had a couple of eight-legged visitors—thankfully just huntsmans, but arachnophobes should beware.

Otherwise, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and felt well looked-after. The Shouse is lovely and welcoming, and Paula is a host who has gone above and beyond in anticipating our every need—and more. For what we got, the price is an absolute steal too. We recommend the Shouse to anyone visiting Armidale!
